refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: These are the public FpDevice routines.

refsect2.title: FpEnrollProgress ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*FpEnrollProgress) (FpDevice *device, gint completed_stages, FpPrint *print, gpointer user_data, GError *error);
refsect2.para: The passed error is guaranteed to be of type FP_DEVICE_RETRY if set.

refsect2.title: FpMatchCb ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*FpMatchCb) (FpDevice *device, FpPrint *match, FpPrint *print, gpointer user_data, GError *error);
refsect2.para: Report the result of a match (identify or verify) operation.
If match is non-NULL, then it is set to the matching FpPrint as passed to the match operation. In this case error will always be NULL.

If error is not NULL then its domain is guaranteed to be FP_DEVICE_RETRY. All other error conditions will not be reported using this callback. If such an error occurs before a match/no-match decision can be made, then this callback will not be called. Should an error happen afterwards, then you will get a match report through this callback and an error when the operation finishes.
If match and error are NULL, then a finger was presented but it did not match any known print.
print represents the newly scanned print. The driver may or may not provide this information. Image based devices will provide it and it allows access to the raw data.

This callback exists because it makes sense for drivers to wait e.g. on finger removal before completing the match operation. However, the success/failure can often be reported at an earlier time, and there is no need to make the user wait.

entry.para: The matching print if any matched print .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The human readable name of the device.

refsect2.title: fp_device_get_scan_type ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the scan type of the device.

refsect2.title: fp_device_get_nr_enroll_stages ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the number of enroll stages for this device.

refsect2.title: fp_device_get_finger_status ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the finger status flags for the device. This can be used by the UI to present the relevant feedback, although it is not guaranteed to be a relevant value when not performing any action.

refsect2.title: fp_device_get_features ()
refsect2.para: Gets the FpDeviceFeature's supported by the device .

refsect2.title: fp_device_has_feature ()
refsect2.para: Checks if device supports the requested FpDeviceFeature's. See fp_device_get_features()

entry.para: FpDeviceFeature flags to check against device supported features

refsect2.title: fp_device_has_storage ()

warning.para: fp_device_has_storage has been deprecated since version 1.92.0 and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Whether the device has on-chip storage. If it has, you can list the prints stored on the with fp_device_list_prints() and you should always delete prints from the device again using fp_device_delete_print().

refsect2.title: fp_device_supports_identify ()

warning.para: fp_device_supports_identify has been deprecated since version 1.92.0 and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Check whether the device supports identification.

refsect2.title: fp_device_supports_capture ()

warning.para: fp_device_supports_capture has been deprecated since version 1.92.0 and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Check whether the device supports capturing images.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: Whether the device supports image capture

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: Whether the device is open or not

refsect2.title: fp_device_open ()
refsect2.programlisting: void fp_device_open (FpDevice *device, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Start an asynchronous operation to open the device. The callback will be called once the operation has finished. Retrieve the result with fp_device_open_finish().

entry.para: the function to call on completion
the data to pass to callback

refsect2.title: fp_device_close ()
refsect2.programlisting: void fp_device_close (FpDevice *device, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Start an asynchronous operation to close the device. The callback will be called once the operation has finished. Retrieve the result with fp_device_close_finish().

entry.para: the function to call on completion
the data to pass to callback

refsect2.title: fp_device_enroll ()
refsect2.programlisting: void fp_device_enroll (FpDevice *device, FpPrint *template_print, GCancellable *cancellable, FpEnrollProgress progress_cb, gpointer progress_data, GDestroyNotify progress_destroy, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Start an asynchronous operation to enroll a print. The callback will be called once the operation has finished. Retrieve the result with fp_device_enroll_finish().

The template_print parameter is a FpPrint with available metadata filled in and, optionally, with existing fingerprint data to be updated with newly enrolled fingerprints if a device driver supports it. The driver may make use of the metadata, when e.g. storing the print on device memory. It is undefined whether this print is filled in by the driver and returned, or whether the driver will return a newly created print after enrollment succeeded.

entry.para: the function to call on completion.
the data to pass to callback

refsect2.title: fp_device_verify ()
refsect2.programlisting: void fp_device_verify (FpDevice *device, FpPrint *enrolled_print, GCancellable *cancellable, FpMatchCb match_cb, gpointer match_data, GDestroyNotify match_destroy, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Start an asynchronous operation to verify a print. The callback will be called once the operation has finished. Retrieve the result with fp_device_verify_finish().

entry.para: the function to call on completion
the data to pass to callback

refsect2.title: fp_device_identify ()
refsect2.programlisting: void fp_device_identify (FpDevice *device, GPtrArray *prints, GCancellable *cancellable, FpMatchCb match_cb, gpointer match_data, GDestroyNotify match_destroy, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Start an asynchronous operation to identify prints. The callback will be called once the operation has finished. Retrieve the result with fp_device_identify_finish().

entry.para: the function to call on completion
the data to pass to callback

refsect2.title: fp_device_capture ()
refsect2.programlisting: void fp_device_capture (FpDevice *device, gboolean wait_for_finger, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Start an asynchronous operation to capture an image. The callback will be called once the operation has finished. Retrieve the result with fp_device_capture_finish().

entry.para: Whether to wait for a finger or not
the function to call on completion
the data to pass to callback

refsect2.title: fp_device_delete_print ()
refsect2.programlisting: void fp_device_delete_print (FpDevice *device, FpPrint *enrolled_print, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Start an asynchronous operation to delete a print from the device. The callback will be called once the operation has finished. Retrieve the result with fp_device_delete_print_finish().
This only makes sense on devices that store prints on-chip, but is safe to always call.

entry.para: the function to call on completion
the data to pass to callback

refsect2.title: fp_device_list_prints ()
refsect2.programlisting: void fp_device_list_prints (FpDevice *device, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Start an asynchronous operation to list all prints stored on the device. This only makes sense on devices that store prints on-chip.
Retrieve the result with fp_device_list_prints_finish().

entry.para: the function to call on completion
the data to pass to callback

refsect2.title: fp_device_clear_storage ()
refsect2.programlisting: void fp_device_clear_storage (FpDevice *device, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Start an asynchronous operation to delete all prints from the device. The callback will be called once the operation has finished. Retrieve the result with fp_device_clear_storage_finish().
This only makes sense on devices that store prints on-chip, but is safe to always call.

entry.para: the function to call on completion
the data to pass to callback

refsect2.title: fp_device_suspend ()
refsect2.programlisting: void fp_device_suspend (FpDevice *device, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Prepare the device for system suspend. Retrieve the result with fp_device_suspend_finish().

The suspend method can be called at any time (even if the device is not opened) and must be paired with a corresponding resume call. It is undefined when or how any ongoing operation is finished. This call might wait for an ongoing operation to finish, might cancel the ongoing operation or may prepare the device so that the host is resumed when the operation can be finished.
If an ongoing operation must be cancelled then it will complete with an error code of FP_DEVICE_ERROR_BUSY before the suspend async routine finishes.
Any operation started while the device is suspended will fail with FP_DEVICE_ERROR_BUSY, this includes calls to open or close the device.

entry.para: a GCancellable, or NULL, currently not used.
the function to call on completion
the data to pass to callback

refsect2.title: fp_device_resume ()
refsect2.programlisting: void fp_device_resume (FpDevice *device, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Resume device after system suspend. Retrieve the result with fp_device_suspend_finish().
Note that it is not defined when any ongoing operation may return (success or error). You must be ready to handle this before, during or after the resume operation.

entry.para: a GCancellable, or NULL, currently not used.
the function to call on completion
the data to pass to callback

refsect2.title: fp_device_open_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finish an asynchronous operation to open the device. See fp_device_open().

entry.para: Return location for errors, or NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: fp_device_close_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finish an asynchronous operation to close the device. See fp_device_close().

entry.para: Return location for errors, or NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: fp_device_enroll_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finish an asynchronous operation to enroll a print. You should check for an error of type FP_DEVICE_RETRY to prompt the user again if there was an interaction issue. See fp_device_enroll().

entry.para: Return location for errors, or NULL to ignore

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The enrolled FpPrint, or NULL on error.

refsect2.title: fp_device_verify_finish ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean fp_device_verify_finish (FpDevice *device, GAsyncResult *result, gboolean *match, FpPrint **print, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Finish an asynchronous operation to verify an enrolled print. You should check for an error of type FP_DEVICE_RETRY to prompt the user again if there was an interaction issue.
With print you can fetch the newly created print and retrieve the image data if available.
See fp_device_verify().

entry.para: Whether the user presented the correct finger.
Location to store the scanned print, or NULL to ignore.
Return location for errors, or NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: fp_device_identify_finish ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean fp_device_identify_finish (FpDevice *device, GAsyncResult *result, FpPrint **match, FpPrint **print, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Finish an asynchronous operation to identify a print. You should check for an error of type FP_DEVICE_RETRY to prompt the user again if there was an interaction issue.
Use match to find the print that matched. With print you can fetch the newly created print and retrieve the image data if available.
See fp_device_identify().

entry.para: Location for the matched FpPrint, or NULL.
Location for the new FpPrint, or NULL.
Return location for errors, or NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: fp_device_capture_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finish an asynchronous operation to capture an image. You should check for an error of type FP_DEVICE_RETRY to prompt the user again if there was an interaction issue.
See fp_device_capture().

entry.para: Return location for errors, or NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: fp_device_delete_print_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finish an asynchronous operation to delete an enrolled print.
See fp_device_delete_print().

entry.para: Return location for errors, or NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: fp_device_list_prints_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finish an asynchronous operation to list all device stored prints.
See fp_device_list_prints().

entry.para: Return location for errors, or NULL to ignore

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: Array of prints or NULL on error.

refsect2.title: fp_device_clear_storage_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finish an asynchronous operation to delete all enrolled prints.
See fp_device_clear_storage().

entry.para: Return location for errors, or NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: fp_device_suspend_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finish an asynchronous operation to prepare the device for suspend. See fp_device_suspend().
The API user should accept an error of FP_DEVICE_ERROR_NOT_SUPPORTED.

entry.para: Return location for errors, or NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: fp_device_resume_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finish an asynchronous operation to resume the device after suspend. See fp_device_resume().
The API user should accept an error of FP_DEVICE_ERROR_NOT_SUPPORTED.

entry.para: Return location for errors, or NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: fp_device_open_sync ()
refsect2.para: Open the device synchronously.

entry.para: Return location for errors, or NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: fp_device_close_sync ()
refsect2.para: Close the device synchronously.

entry.para: Return location for errors, or NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: fp_device_enroll_sync ()
refsect2.programlisting: FpPrint * fp_device_enroll_sync (FpDevice *device, FpPrint *template_print, GCancellable *cancellable, FpEnrollProgress progress_cb, gpointer progress_data, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Enroll a new print. See fp_device_enroll(). It is undefined whether template_print is updated or a newly created FpPrint is returned.

entry.para: A FpPrint to fill in or use as a template.
Return location for errors, or NULL to ignore

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A FpPrint on success, NULL otherwise.

refsect2.title: fp_device_verify_sync ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean fp_device_verify_sync (FpDevice *device, FpPrint *enrolled_print, GCancellable *cancellable, FpMatchCb match_cb, gpointer match_data, gboolean *match, FpPrint **print, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Verify a given print synchronously.

entry.para: Whether the user presented the correct finger.
Location to store the scanned print, or NULL to ignore.
Return location for errors, or NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: fp_device_identify_sync ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean fp_device_identify_sync (FpDevice *device, GPtrArray *prints, GCancellable *cancellable, FpMatchCb match_cb, gpointer match_data, FpPrint **match, FpPrint **print, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Identify a print synchronously.

entry.para: Location for the matched FpPrint, or NULL.
Location for the new FpPrint, or NULL.
Return location for errors, or NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: fp_device_capture_sync ()
refsect2.programlisting: FpImage * fp_device_capture_sync (FpDevice *device, gboolean wait_for_finger, GCancellable *cancellable, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Start an synchronous operation to capture an image.

entry.para: Whether to wait for a finger or not
Return location for errors, or NULL to ignore

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A new FpImage or NULL on error.

refsect2.title: fp_device_delete_print_sync ()
refsect2.para: Delete a given print from the device.

entry.para: Return location for errors, or NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: fp_device_list_prints_sync ()
refsect2.para: List device stored prints synchronously.

entry.para: Return location for errors, or NULL to ignore

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: Array of prints, or NULL on error.

refsect2.title: fp_device_clear_storage_sync ()
refsect2.para: Clear sensor storage.

entry.para: Return location for errors, or NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: fp_device_suspend_sync ()
refsect2.para: Prepare device for suspend.

entry.para: a GCancellable, or NULL, currently not used.
Return location for errors, or NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: fp_device_resume_sync ()
refsect2.para: Resume device after suspend.

entry.para: a GCancellable, or NULL, currently not used.
Return location for errors, or NULL to ignore
The device is a virtual device
The device is a udev device
The device is a USB device
Device does not support any feature
Whether the device can run continuously
Supports updating an existing print record using new scans
Sensor requires placing/pressing down the finger.

refsect2.title: enum FpDeviceRetry
refsect2.para: Error codes representing scan failures resulting in the user needing to retry.

entry.para: The scan did not succeed due to poor scan quality or other general user scanning problem.
The scan did not succeed because the finger swipe was too short.
The scan did not succeed because the finger was not centered on the scanner.
The scan did not succeed due to quality or pressure problems; the user should remove their finger from the scanner before retrying.
The scan did not succeed because the finger swipe or touch was too fast.

refsect2.title: enum FpDeviceError
refsect2.para: Error codes for device operations. More specific errors from other domains such as G_IO_ERROR or G_USB_DEVICE_ERROR may also be reported.

entry.para: The device does not support the requested operation.
The device needs to be opened to start this operation.
The device has already been opened.
The device is busy with another request.
Requested print was not found on device
No space on device available for operation
The device might be getting too hot
Sensor has not the finger on it, nor requires it
Sensor has the finger on it

refsect2.title: The device-id property
refsect2.para: String describing the device, often generic but may be a serial number.
Owner: FpDevice
Flags: Read
Default value: ""

refsect2.title: The driver property
refsect2.para: String describing the driver.
Owner: FpDevice
Flags: Read
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The finger-status property
refsect2.para: The status of the finger.
Owner: FpDevice
Flags: Read

refsect2.title: The fpi-driver-data property
refsect2.para: Private: The driver data from the ID table entry.
Owner: FpDevice
Flags: Write / Construct Only
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The fpi-environ property
refsect2.para: Private: The environment variable for the virtual device.
Owner: FpDevice
Flags: Write / Construct Only
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The fpi-udev-data-hidraw property
refsect2.para: Private: The path to /dev/hidrawN.
Owner: FpDevice
Flags: Read / Write / Construct Only
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The fpi-udev-data-spidev property
refsect2.para: Private: The path to /dev/spidevN.M.
Owner: FpDevice
Flags: Read / Write / Construct Only
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The fpi-usb-device property
refsect2.para: Private: The USB device for the device.
Owner: FpDevice
Flags: Read / Write / Construct Only

refsect2.title: The name property
refsect2.para: Human readable name for the device.
Owner: FpDevice
Flags: Read
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The nr-enroll-stages property
refsect2.para: Number of enroll stages needed on the device.
Owner: FpDevice
Flags: Read
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The open property
refsect2.para: Whether the device is open or not.
Owner: FpDevice
Flags: Read
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The removed property
refsect2.para: Whether the device has been removed from the system.
Owner: FpDevice
Flags: Read
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The scan-type property
refsect2.para: The scan type of the device.
Owner: FpDevice
Flags: Read
Default value: FP_SCAN_TYPE_SWIPE

refsect2.title: The temperature property
refsect2.para: The temperature estimation for device to prevent overheating.
Owner: FpDevice
Flags: Read
Default value: FP_TEMPERATURE_COLD

refsect2.title: The removed signal
refsect2.para: This signal is emitted after the device has been removed and no operation is pending anymore.
The API user is still required to close a removed device. The above guarantee means that the call to close the device can be made immediately from the signal handler.
The close operation will return FP_DEVICE_ERROR_REMOVED, but the device will still be considered closed afterwards.
The device will only be removed from the FpContext after it has been closed by the API user.

entry.para: the FpDevice instance that emitted the signal

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Flags: Run Last
